name: axonometric
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
An axonometric image or view of something is one that shows an object that is turned in such a way that you can see three sides of it at the same time: As part of her training to become an architect, she learned how to make axonometric projections. He made a rough sketch of the landscape in pencil, working from an axonometric view.
More examplesFewer examplesThe architect presented an axonometric projection of his plans for the new building to the city council. Axonometric drawings help an architect consider both the empirical and subjective aspects of a project.
